citation.case_name: Jefferson Lake Sulphur Co. v. New Jersey

html_lawbox:
370 U.S. 158 (1962)

JEFFERSON LAKE SULPHUR CO.
v.
NEW JERSEY.

No. 861.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided June 4, 1962.
APPEAL FROM THE SUPREME COURT OF NEW JERSEY.

Eberhard P. Deutsch, Rene H. Himel, Jr. and Arthur C. Dwyer for appellant.

Arthur J. Sills, Attorney General of New Jersey, Theodore I. Botter, First Assistant Attorney General, and Charles J. Kehoe, Deputy Attorney General, for appellee.

PER CURIAM.

The motion to dismiss is granted and the appeal is dismissed. Treating the papers whereon the appeal was taken as a petition for writ of certiorari, certiorari is denied.

MR. JUSTICE FRANKFURTER took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.

html:
370 U.S. 158

82 S.Ct. 1253

8 L.Ed.2d 402

JEFFERSON LAKE SULPHUR CO.
v.
STATE OF NEW JERSEY.

No. 861.

Supreme Court of the United States

June 4, 1962

Eberhard P. Deutsch, Rene H. Himel, Jr. and Arthur C. Dwyer, for appellant.

Arthur J. Sills, Atty. Gen. of New Jersey, Theodore I. Botter, First Asst. Atty. Gen., and Charles J. Kehoe, Deputy Atty. Gen., for appellee.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion to dismiss is granted and the appeal is dismissed. Treating the papers whereon the appeal was taken as a petition for writ of certiorari, certiorari is denied.

2

Mr. Justice FRANKFURTER took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
